snippet: The Mets scaled back an event planned with the nonprofit American Indian Community House when they realized they were to host the Atlanta Braves the same day.
abstract: New York Mets scale back long-planned event with nonprofit American Indian Community House after realizing team would host Atlanta Braves on same day; Mets front office fears that celebration of Native American culture might be interpreted as protest by Braves over its nickname, which has generated controversy in past; AICH pulls out of event altogether, citing frustration with the Mets for thwarting months of planning.
lead_paragraph: The Mets scaled back an event planned with the nonprofit American Indian Community House when they realized they were to host the Atlanta Braves the same day.

headline.main: Mets Alter Event, Upsetting American Indian Group
headline.print_headline: Mets Alter Event, Upsetting American Indian Group
